videos.title: Tiny Cyberpunk 2077 by Flurdeh (2021)
videos.description: Flurdeh specializes in applying a "tilt-shift" effect to video games, transforming their expansive 3D environments into charming miniature dioramas. The videos share common features such as accelerated animations and a lower framerate, enhancing their resemblance to stop-motion animation rather than modern video game footage. An example highlighted is Cyberpunk, where the game's diverse settings are miniaturized, and characters are depicted as if they were tiny figurines engaging in everyday activities.
videos.additional_info:
Tiny Cyberpunk 2077 by Flurdeh (2021)
Flurdeh specializes in applying a "tilt-shift" effect to video games, transforming their expansive 3D environments into charming miniature dioramas. The videos share common features such as accelerated animations and a lower framerate, enhancing their resemblance to stop-motion animation rather than modern video game footage. An example highlighted is Cyberpunk, where the game's diverse settings are miniaturized, and characters are depicted as if they were tiny figurines engaging in everyday activities.
Technique - Aerial , Dystopian , Tilt Shift , Video Game
Editor - Kevin Hensen
Original Source - Link

videos.title: THEY. - U-RITE (2017)
videos.description: The music video for "U-RITE" by THEY. was filmed entirely in Colorado, featuring various locations including mountains, a chairlift, Red Rocks, and Denver. It showcases the duo's connection to Dante's home state with dynamic editing that syncs with the beat of the song.

videos.title: Fast motion clip from Nohyal
videos.description: Fast motion vs. Timelapse? "Fast Motion" video is typically shot at a normal frame rate, and then sped up afterwards. "Timelapse" uses a longer interval between frames, and then plays back at a normal frame rate. It's the difference between hours or days sped into seconds vs minutes sped into seconds. Shot breakdown: Aerial Fast motion drone tilt down
videos.additional_info:
Fast motion clip from Nohyal
Fast motion vs. Timelapse? "Fast Motion" video is typically shot at a normal frame rate, and then sped up afterwards. "Timelapse" uses a longer interval between frames, and then plays back at a normal frame rate. It's the difference between hours or days sped into seconds vs minutes sped into seconds. Shot breakdown: Aerial Fast motion drone tilt down
Technique - Aerial , Fast Motion
Director - Nohyal

videos.title: Sabrina Carpenter - Espresso (2024)
videos.description: The music video for Sabrina Carpenter's song "Espresso," released in 2024, was directed by Dave Meyers. The video features vibrant and sun-soaked visuals, showcasing Carpenter in various stylish outfits as she navigates a dreamy, retro-inspired setting. With a playful and energetic vibe, the video highlights Carpenter's charisma and the song's catchy, upbeat nature. The creative direction was managed by Jacobi Mehringer and Anna Arnell, adding to the video's polished and dynamic aesthetic.
videos.additional_info:
Sabrina Carpenter - Espresso (2024)
The music video for Sabrina Carpenter's song "Espresso," released in 2024, was directed by Dave Meyers. The video features vibrant and sun-soaked visuals, showcasing Carpenter in various stylish outfits as she navigates a dreamy, retro-inspired setting. With a playful and energetic vibe, the video highlights Carpenter's charisma and the song's catchy, upbeat nature. The creative direction was managed by Jacobi Mehringer and Anna Arnell, adding to the video's polished and dynamic aesthetic.

videos.title: Watchtower of China (2022)
videos.description: A cinematic exploration capturing the vast diversity and spirit of China through seamless edits and fluid camera work over five years of filming and editing. The project, which extends Dalessandri's unique visual storytelling seen in "Watchtower of Turkey," presents a rich tapestry of China's landscapes, people, and culture, set to the emotive compositions of Ezio Bosso. The film is acclaimed for its vibrant portrayal and deep personal vision of China, reflecting the interconnected energy of its inhabitants and their surroundings.
videos.additional_info:
Watchtower of China (2022)
A cinematic exploration capturing the vast diversity and spirit of China through seamless edits and fluid camera work over five years of filming and editing. The project, which extends Dalessandri's unique visual storytelling seen in "Watchtower of Turkey," presents a rich tapestry of China's landscapes, people, and culture, set to the emotive compositions of Ezio Bosso. The film is acclaimed for its vibrant portrayal and deep personal vision of China, reflecting the interconnected energy of its inhabitants and their surroundings.
Technique - Aerial , Match motion
Director - Leonardo Dalessandri
